    JasonILTG and syy1125

        Tries to insert a given Item into a player inventory, and drops it if not successful.
        Parameters:
        world - The World
        pos - The BlockPos
        player - The player
        toInsert - The Item to insert
        numToInsert - The number of items to insert

      • findInsertPattern

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] findInsertPattern(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stackToInsert,
                                                               net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] insertTarget)
        Finds an insertion pattern of the given ItemStack into the given inventory. This method will attempt to find the stacks with matching items and fill those stacks first.
        Parameters:
        stackToInsert - The ItemStack to insert
        insertTarget - The ItemStack array to insert into
        Returns:
        The insertion pattern; null if the given stack cannot be inserted

      • findInsertPattern

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] findInsertPattern(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] stacksToInsert,
                                                               net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] insertTarget)
        A variant of findInsertPattern that inserts an array of ItemStacks.
        Parameters:
        stacksToInsert - The ItemStack array to insert
        insertTarget - The ItemStack array to insert into
        Returns:
        The insertion pattern; null if the given stacks cannot be inserted

      • mergeStackArrays

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] mergeStackArrays(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] stackArray1,
                                                              net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] stackArray2)
        Merges together two ItemStack arrays. Warning: if there are item type mismatches, the slot will be set to null. The stack size may also go over the limit if you are not careful.
        Parameters:
        stackArray1 - The first ItemStack array
        stackArray2 - The second ItemStack array
        Returns:
        The merge result of the two stacks.

        Parameters:
        stacks - The inventory to check through

      • pullStack

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack pullStack(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stackToPull,
                                                     net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] inventoryToPullFrom)
        TODO WIP method to pull an item stack out of an inventory.
        Parameters:
        stackToPull - The stack to pull
        inventoryToPullFrom - The inventory to pull from
        Returns:
        The pulled stack; this should be equal to the stackToPull parameter. If the stack cannot be pulled, null is returned.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The flattened inventory

      • separateInventories

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[][] separateInventories(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack[] inventory,
                                                                   int[] sectionLengths)
        Takes a 1D ItemStack inventory array and turns it into a 2D array of inventory sections.
        Parameters:
        inventory - The flat inventory
        sectionLengths - The lengths of the inventory's sections
        Returns:
        The 2D array of the inventory split into sections
